26.verse: Then it proceeds, and takes along seven other spirits more evil than itself. And having gone in, they dwell there. And the last state of that person becomes worse than the first”.

27.verse: Blessed Are Those Hearing And Keeping The Word of God - And it came about during His saying these things that a certain woman from the crowd, having raised her voice, said to Him, “Blessed is the womb having carried You, and the breasts which You sucked”.

28.verse: But He said, “More-than-that, blessed are the ones hearing the word of God and keeping it”.

29.verse: This Is an Evil Generation. No Sign Will Be Given Except The Sign of Jonah - And while the crowds were assembling-more, He began to say “This generation is an evil generation. It is seeking a sign. And a sign will not be given to it except the sign of Jonah.

30.verse: For as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so the Son of Man also will be to this generation.

31.verse: The Queen of the South will be raised at the judgment with the men of this generation, and she will condemn them. Because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold— a greater thing than Solomon is here.

32.verse: Ninevite men will rise-up at the judgment with this generation, and they will condemn it. Because they repented at the proclamation of Jonah, and behold— a greater thing than Jonah is here.

33.verse: The Lamp Shines So People Can See. Watch Out That Your Eye Can Receive The Light - “No one having lit a lamp puts it in a crypt, nor under the basket, but on the lampstand, in order that the ones coming in may see the light.

34.verse: The lamp of the body is your eye. When your eye is single, your whole body is also full-of-light. But when it is bad, your body is also full-of-darkness.

35.verse: So be watching-out that the light in you is not darkness!

36.verse: Therefore if your whole body is full-of-light, not having any part full-of-darkness, [then] the whole body will be full-of-light as when the lamp gives-light-to you with its bright-light”.

37.verse: Woe To You Pharisees - Now at the speaking, a Pharisee asks Him so that He might eat-the-morning-meal with him. And having gone in, He fell-back [to eat].

38.verse: And the Pharisee, having seen it, marveled that He was not first cleansed before the morning-meal.

39.verse: But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and the platter, but the inside of you is full of plundering and evilness.

40.verse: Foolish ones— did not the One having made the outside also make the inside?

41.verse: But give the things being-within as alms, and behold— all things are clean for you.

42.verse: But woe to you Pharisees, because you are giving-a-tenth-of the mint and the rue and every garden-plant, and are disregarding the justice and the love of God. But you ought-to-have done these things, and not be slackening those things.

43.verse: Woe to you Pharisees, because you love the seat-of-honor in the synagogues and the greetings in the marketplaces.

44.verse: Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, and the people walking over them do not know it ”.

45.verse: Woe To You Law-Experts - And having responded, one of the Law-experts says to Him, “Teacher, while saying these things You also are insulting us”.

46.verse: And the One said, “Woe to you Law-experts also, because you burden people with hard-to-bear burdens, and you do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.

47.verse: Woe to you, because you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them!

48.verse: Therefore you are witnesses and are giving-approval to the works of your fathers, because they killed them— and you build their tombs.

49.verse: For this reason the wisdom of God also said, ‘I will send-forth prophets and apostles to them, and some of them they will kill and persecute,

50.verse: in order that the blood of all the prophets having been shed since the foundation of the world may be required from this generation—

51.verse: from the blood of Abel up to the blood of Zechariah, the one having perished between the altar and the house [of God]. Yes, I say to you, it shall be required from this generation’.

52.verse: Woe to you Law-experts, because you took away the key of knowledge. You did not enter, and you hindered the ones entering”.

53.verse: With His Enemies Lying In Wait To Destroy Him, Myriads Gather To Hear Jesus - And He having gone out from there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly hostile, and to question Him concerning more things

54.verse: while lying-in-wait-for Him to catch something from His mouth—

1.verse: in which circumstances, the myriads of the crowd having been gathered-together so that they were trampling one another: Watch Out For The Leaven of The Pharisees, But Do Not Fear Them -He began to speak to His disciples first, “Take heed to yourselves because of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

2.verse: But nothing has been covered-up which will not be revealed, and is secret which will not be known.

3.verse: Because whatever you said in the darkness will be heard in the light. And what you spoke to the ear in the inner-rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.

4.verse: And I say to you My friends, do not fear anything from the ones killing the body, and after these things not having anything more to do.

5.verse: But I will show you Whom you should fear— fear the One having the authority to throw into Gehenna after the killing. Yes, I say to you, fear this One.

6.verse: Are not five sparrows sold for two assarion? And one of them has not been forgotten before God.

7.verse: Yet even the hairs of your head have all been numbered. Do not be fearing; you are more valuable than many sparrows.

8.verse: And I say to you, everyone who confesses Me in front of people, the Son of Man also will confess him in front of the angels of God.

9.verse: But the one having denied Me before people will be denied before the angels of God.

10.verse: And everyone who shall speak a word against the Son of Man— it will be forgiven to him. But to the one having blasphemed against the Holy Spirit— it will not be forgiven.

11.verse: And whenever they bring you in before the synagogues and the rulers and the authorities, do not be anxious-about how or what you should speak-in-defense, or what you should say.

12.verse: For the Holy Spirit will teach you at the very hour the things which you ought-to say”.

13.verse: Life Is Not In What Abounds To You From Your Possessions. Be Rich Toward God - And someone from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me”.

14.verse: But the One said to him, “Man, who appointed Me judge or arbitrator over you?”

15.verse: And He said to them, “Watch out and guard yourselves from all greed, because one’s life is not in what abounds to him out of his possessions”.

16.verse: And He spoke a parable to them, saying, “The land of a certain rich man was productive.

17.verse: And he was reasoning within himself, saying, ‘What should I do, because I do not have a place where I will gather my fruits?’

18.verse: And he said, ‘I will do this— I will tear-down my barns and build larger ones, and there I will gather all my grain and good things.

19.verse: And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many good things lying-in-store for many years. Be resting. Eat, drink. Be enjoying-yourself ”’.

20.verse: But God said to him, ‘Foolish one! On this night they are demanding your life from you. And the things which you prepared— for whom will they be?’

21.verse: So is the one storing-up for himself, and not being rich toward God”.

22.verse: Do Not Worry About The Necessities of This Life; Seek God’s Kingdom - And He said to His disciples, “For this reason, I say to you, do not be anxious for your life as to what you may eat, nor for your body as to what you may put-on.

23.verse: For life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.

24.verse: Consider the ravens— that they do not sow nor reap, for which there is not a storeroom nor a barn. And God feeds them. How much more are you worth than the birds!

25.verse: And which of you while being anxious is able to add a cubit upon his life-span?

26.verse: If then you are not even able to do a very little thing, why are you anxious about the rest?

27.verse: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They do not labor nor spin, but I say to you— not even Solomon in all his glory clothed himself like one of these!

28.verse: But if God dresses in this manner the grass in a field existing today and being thrown into an oven tomorrow, how much more will He care for you— ones-of-little-faith?

29.verse: And don’t you be seeking what you may eat and what you may drink. And do not be unsettled.

30.verse: For the nations of the world are seeking-after all these things. And your Father knows that you have need of these things.

31.verse: But be seeking His kingdom, and these things will be added to you.

32.verse: Do Not Fear. Sell Your Possessions For a Heavenly Return - “Do not be fearing, little flock, because your Father was well-pleased to give you the kingdom.

33.verse: Sell your possessions, and give it as alms. Make yourselves money-bags not becoming-old— an unfailing treasure in the heavens, where a thief does not draw-near, nor does a moth destroy.

34.verse: For where your treasure is, there also your heart will be.

35.verse: Keep Watch For Your Master’s Return. Be Prepared - Let your waists be girded and your lamps burning,

36.verse: and you be like people waiting-for their master when he departs from the wedding-celebrations— in order that he having come and having knocked, they may immediately open [the door] for him.

37.verse: Blessed are those slaves whom the master, having come, will find keeping-watch. Truly I say to you that he will gird himself, and have them lie back [to eat]. And having come-to the table, he will serve them.

38.verse: Even if in the second, even if he comes in the third watch and finds them so, blessed are those ones.

39.verse: And you know this saying— that if the house-master had known at which hour the thief was coming, he would not have permitted his house to be broken-into.

40.verse: You also be prepared ones, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour which you do not expect”.

41.verse: Wise Servants Found Working When The Master Returns Will Be Rewarded - And Peter said, “Lord, are You speaking this parable to us, or also to everyone?”

42.verse: And the Lord said, “Who then is the faithful, wise steward whom his master will put-in-charge over his body-of-servants, that he might be giving them their food-allowance at the proper-time?

43.verse: Blessed is that slave whom his master, having come, will find so doing.

44.verse: Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge over all his possessions.

45.verse: But if that slave says in his heart, ‘My master is delaying to come’, and he begins to strike the male-servants and the female-servants, and to eat and drink and get-drunk—

46.verse: the master of that slave will come on a day which he does not expect, and at an hour which he does not know. And he will cut him in two, and assign him his part with the unbelievers.

47.verse: But that slave having known the will of his master, and not having prepared or acted in accordance with his will, will be beaten many blows.

48.verse: But the one not having known, and having done things worthy of blows, will be beaten a few blows. And to everyone whom much was given, much will be sought from him. And to whom they entrusted much, they will ask him even more.

49.verse: I Came To Cause Division On Earth, Not To Bring It Peace - “I came to cast fire upon the earth; and how I wish that it were already kindled!

50.verse: But I have a baptism to be baptized; and how I am held by it until it is accomplished!

51.verse: Do you think that I came to grant peace on earth? No, I say to you, but rather division!

52.verse: For from now on, there will be five in one house having been divided— three against two, and two against three.

53.verse: They will be divided— father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law”.

54.verse: Read The Signs of The Times. Judge For Yourselves - And He was also saying to the crowds, “Whenever you see the cloud rising in the west, immediately you say that ‘A rainstorm is coming’, and so it happens.

55.verse: And whenever a south wind is blowing, you say that ‘There will be burning-heat’, and it happens.

56.verse: Hypocrites! You know-how to test the appearance of the earth and the heaven, but how is it you do not know-how to test this time?

57.verse: And why also are you not judging the right thing from yourselves?

58.verse: For as you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, make an effort on the way to be released from him, so that he may not perhaps drag you before the judge, and the judge will hand you over to the bailiff, and the bailiff will throw you into prison.

59.verse: I say to you, you will by no means come out from there until you pay even the last leptos”.

1.verse: Unless You Repent, You Will Perish - And some were present at the very time, reporting to Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate mixed with their sacrifices.

2.verse: And having responded, He said to them, “Do you think that these Galileans were sinners more than all the Galileans, because they have suffered these things?

3.verse: No, I say to you. But unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.

4.verse: Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them— do you think that they were debtors more than all the people dwelling in Jerusalem?

5.verse: No, I say to you. But unless you repent, you will all similarly perish”.

6.verse: If The Tree Does Not Bear Fruit, It Will Be Cut Down - And He was telling this parable— “A certain one had a fig tree having been planted in his vineyard. And he came seeking fruit on it, and did not find it.

7.verse: And he said to the vine-keeper, ‘Behold— it is three years from which time I am coming seeking fruit on this fig tree, and I am not finding it. Therefore, cut it down! Why is it even using-up the soil?’

8.verse: But the one, having responded, says to him, ‘Master, leave it also this year, until I dig around it and throw manure.

9.verse: And if it produces fruit in the future— otherwise indeed, cut it down’”.

10.verse: Jesus Heals a Woman On The Sabbath. The Synagogue Official Objects - Now He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath,

11.verse: and behold— there was a woman having a spirit of  infirmity eighteen years. And she was bending-over, and not being able to bend-up completely.

12.verse: And having seen her, Jesus called to her and said to her, “Woman, you have been released from your infirmity”.

13.verse: And He laid His hands on her. And at-once she was made-straight. And she was glorifying God.

14.verse: But having responded, the synagogue official— being indignant because Jesus cured on the Sabbath— was saying to the crowd that “There are six days on which one ought-to work. So be cured while coming on them, and not on the day of the Sabbath”.

15.verse: But the Lord responded to him and said, “Hypocrites! Does not each of you on the Sabbath release his ox or donkey from the manger, and having led it away, water it?

16.verse: But this one, being a daughter of Abraham whom Satan bound for behold, ten and eight years— ought she not to have been released from this bond on the day of the Sabbath?”

17.verse: And while He was saying these things, all the ones being opposed to Him were being put-to-shame. The Crowd Rejoices Over What Jesus Did. He Says, The Kingdom of God Starts Small -And the whole crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things being done by Him.

18.verse: Therefore, He was saying, “To what is the kingdom of God like, and to what shall I liken it?

19.verse: It is like a seed of a mustard-plant which, having taken, a man threw into his own garden. And it grew and became a tree. And the birds of the heaven nested in its branches”.

20.verse: And again He said, “To what shall I liken the kingdom of God?

21.verse: It is like leaven, which having taken, a woman concealed into three measures of wheat-flour until which time the whole thing was leavened”.

22.verse: Enter Through The Narrow Door Before It Is Too Late - And He was journeying-through according to cities and villages, teaching and making the journey to Jerusalem.

23.verse: And someone said to Him, “Master, are the ones being saved few?” And the One said to them,

24.verse: “Be striving to enter through the narrow door, because many, I say to you, will seek to enter, and will not be able.

25.verse: From whatever time the house-master arises and shuts the door, and you begin to stand outside and to be knocking on the door saying ‘Master, open for us’, and having responded, he will say to you, ‘I do not know you, where you are from’—

26.verse: then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught on our wide-roads’.

27.verse: And he will speak, saying to you, ‘I do not know you— where you are from. Depart from me, all you workers of unrighteousness’.

28.verse: In that place, there will be the weeping and the grinding of teeth when you shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you being thrown outside.

29.verse: And they will come from east and west, and from north and south, and lie back [to eat] in the kingdom of God.

30.verse: And behold— there are last ones who will be first, and there are first ones who will be last”.

31.verse: Jesus Proceeds Away From Herod, Because a Prophet Cannot Perish Outside Jerusalem - At the very hour, some Pharisees came to Him, saying to Him, “Go out, and proceed from here, because Herod wants to kill You”.

32.verse: And He said to them, “Having gone, tell this fox, ‘Behold— I am casting-out demons and performing healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I come-to-the-end’.

33.verse: Nevertheless, I must proceed today and tomorrow and the next day, because it cannot-be that a prophet should perish outside of Jerusalem.

34.verse: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one killing the prophets and stoning the ones having been sent to her. How often I wanted to gather-together your children the way a hen does her own brood under her wings, and you did not want it.

35.verse: Behold— your house is being left to you. And I say to you, you will by no means see Me until the time will come when you say, ‘Blessed is the One coming in the name of the Lord’”.

1.verse: At The House of a Pharisee, Jesus Heals a Man With Dropsy On The Sabbath - And it came about at His going into the house of one of the leaders of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat bread, that they were closely-watching Him.

2.verse: And behold— a certain man in front of Him was suffering-from-dropsy.

3.verse: And having responded, Jesus spoke to the Law-experts and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to cure on the Sabbath, or not?”

4.verse: But the ones were quiet. And having taken-hold-of him, He healed him, and sent him away.

5.verse: And He said to them, “Whose son or ox of yours will fall into a well, and he will not immediately pull him up on the day of the Sabbath?”

6.verse: And they were not able to answer-back to these things.

7.verse: Jesus Says To The Ones Invited, Humble Yourself. Wait On The One Who Invited You - And He was speaking a parable to the ones having been invited, fixing-His-attention-on how they were choosing the places-of-honor, saying to them—

8.verse: “Whenever you are invited by someone to wedding-celebrations, do not lie down [to eat] in the place-of-honor lest a more distinguished one than you may have been invited by him,

9.verse: and having come, the one having invited you and him will say to you, ‘Give your place to this one’, and then you will begin to hold the last place with shame.

10.verse: But whenever you are invited, having gone, fall back [to eat] in the last place, so that when the one having invited you comes, he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher’. Then there will be glory for you in the presence of all the ones reclining back with you [to eat].

11.verse: Because everyone exalting himself will be humbled. And the one humbling himself will be exalted”.

12.verse: Jesus Says To The One Who Invited Him, Serve Those Who Cannot Repay - And He was also saying to the one having invited Him, “Whenever you make a morning-meal or a dinner, do not be calling your friends, nor your brothers, nor your relatives, nor rich neighbors— that they also might not perhaps invite you in return, and it become a repayment to you.

13.verse: But whenever you make a reception, be inviting poor ones, crippled ones, lame ones, blind ones,

14.verse: and you will be blessed because they do not have the means to repay you. For it will be repaid to you at the resurrection of the righteous”.

15.verse: When The Invited Are Not Willing To Come, The Uninvited Will Be Welcomed - And one of the ones reclining back with Him [to eat], having heard these things, said to Him, “Blessed is whoever will eat bread in the kingdom of God!”

16.verse: But the One said to him— “A certain man was making a great dinner, and he invited many.

17.verse: And he sent-out his slave at the hour of the dinner to say to the ones having been invited, ‘Come, because it is already prepared’.

18.verse: And they all alike began to excuse-themselves. The first said to him, ‘I bought a field. And I have a necessity, having gone out, to see it. I ask you, have me excused’.

19.verse: And another said, ‘I bought five pair of oxen, and I am proceeding to test them. I ask you, have me excused’.

20.verse: And another said, ‘I married a woman, and for this reason I am not able to come’.

21.verse: And having come, the slave reported these things to his master. Then, having become-angry, the house-master said to his slave, ‘Go out quickly into the wide-roads and lanes of the city, and bring in here the poor ones and crippled ones and blind ones and lame ones’.

22.verse: And the slave said, ‘Master, what you commanded has been done, and there is still room’.

23.verse: And the master said to the slave, ‘Go out to the roads and fences, and compel them to come in, in order that my house may be filled.

24.verse: For I say to you all that none of those men having been invited will taste my dinner’”.

25.verse: Carry Your Own Cross And Follow Me. Calculate The Cost First - And large crowds were proceeding-with Him. And having turned, He said to them,

26.verse: “If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his own father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, and furthermore, even his own life, he cannot be My disciple.

27.verse: Whoever is not carrying his own cross and coming after Me, cannot be My disciple.

28.verse: For which of you wanting to build a tower does not first, having sat-down, calculate the cost to see whether he has enough for the completion?—

29.verse: in order that he having laid a foundation and not being able to finish it out, all the ones observing may not perhaps begin to mock him,

30.verse: saying that ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish it out!’

31.verse: Or what king going to engage another king in battle will not, having sat-down first, deliberate whether he is able with ten thousand men to meet the one coming against him with twenty thousand?

32.verse: Otherwise indeed, the one coming still being far away— the king, having sent-forth a delegation, asks the things for peace.

33.verse: So therefore, any of you who is not saying-goodbye to all his possessions cannot be My disciple.

34.verse: Therefore, salt is good. But if indeed the salt should become-tasteless, with what will it be seasoned?

35.verse: It is fit neither for soil nor for the manure-pile. They throw it outside. Let the one having ears to hear, hear”.

1.verse: Parables For Sinners And Pharisees - Now all the tax-collectors and the sinners were drawing-near to Him to hear Him.

2.verse: And both the Pharisees and the scribes were grumbling, saying that “This One is welcoming sinners and eating with them”.

3.verse: The Lost Sheep And Lost Coin: Heaven Rejoices When a Sinner Repents - And He spoke this parable to them, saying

4.verse: “What man from-among you having a hundred sheep and having lost one of them, does not leave-behind the ninety nine in the wilderness and proceed after the one having become-lost until he finds it?

5.verse: And having found it, he puts it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

6.verse: And having come to the house, he calls-together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice-with me, because I found my lost sheep!’

7.verse: I say to you that in this manner there will be joy in heaven over one sinner repenting more-than over ninety nine righteous ones who have no need of repentance.

8.verse: Or what woman having ten drachmas, if she loses one drachma, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and seek carefully until which time she finds it ?

9.verse: And having found it, she calls together her women friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice-with me, because I found the drachma which I lost!’

10.verse: In this manner, I say to you, joy comes-about in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting”.

11.verse: The Prodigal Son: The Father Rejoices When His Lost Son Returns - And He said, “A certain man had two sons.

12.verse: And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the part of your substance falling to me’. And the one distributed his property to them.

13.verse: And after not many days, having gathered together everything, the younger son went-on-a-journey to a distant country. And there he squandered his substance living wildly.

14.verse: And he having spent everything, a severe famine came about in relation to that country, and he began to be-in-need.

15.verse: And having gone, he joined himself to one of the citizens of that country. And he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

16.verse: And he was desiring to be filled-to-satisfaction with the carob-pods which the pigs were eating. And no one was giving anything to him.

17.verse: But having come to himself, he said, ‘How many hired-workers of my father are abounding with bread, but I am perishing here in a famine!

18.verse: Having arisen, I will proceed to my father and say to him, “Father, I sinned against heaven and in your sight.

19.verse: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired-workers”’.

20.verse: And having arisen, he went to his father. But he still being far distant, his father saw him and felt-deep-feelings [of love]. And having run, he fell upon his neck and kissed him.

21.verse: And the son said to him, ‘Father, I sinned against heaven and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son’.

22.verse: But the father said to his slaves, ‘Quickly, bring-out the best robe and put it on him. And give him a ring for his hand and sandals for the feet.

23.verse: And bring the fatted calf. Slaughter it. And having eaten, let us celebrate!

24.verse: Because this son of mine was dead, and he became-alive-again. He had become-lost, and he was found’. And they began to celebrate.

25.verse: The Older Brother Is Angered By His Father’s Joy - “Now his older son was in the field. And when while coming he drew-near to the house, he heard music and dancing.

26.verse: And having summoned one of the servants, he was inquiring as to what these things might be.

27.verse: And the one said to him that ‘Your brother has come. And your father slaughtered the fatted calf because he received him back being healthy’.

28.verse: And he became-angry, and was not willing to go in. And his father, having come out, was appealing-to him.

29.verse: But the one, having responded, said to his father, ‘Behold— I am slaving for you for so many years, and I never disregarded your command. And you never gave me a goat in order that I might celebrate with my friends.

30.verse: But when this son of yours came— the one having devoured your property with prostitutes— you slaughtered the fatted calf for him!’

31.verse: And the one said to him, ‘Child, you are always with me, and all my things are yours.

32.verse: But it-was-necessary to celebrate and rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead, and he became-alive. And he had become-lost, and he was found’”.

1.verse: The Unrighteous Steward: Use Earthly Money For Heavenly Gain - And He was also saying to the disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a steward. And this one was accused to him as squandering his possessions.

2.verse: And having called him, he said to him, ‘What is this I am hearing about you? Render the account of your stewardship, for you can no longer be steward’.

3.verse: And the steward said within himself, ‘What should I do, because my master is taking-away the stewardship from me? I am not strong-enough to dig. I am ashamed to beg.

4.verse: I know what I will do so that they will welcome me into their houses when I am removed from the stewardship’.

5.verse: And having summoned each one of the debtors of his master, he was saying to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my master?’

6.verse: And the one said, ‘A hundred baths of olive-oil’. And the one said to him, ‘Take your writings, and having sat-down quickly, write fifty’.

7.verse: Then he said to another, ‘And you, how much do you owe?’ And the one said, ‘A hundred cor of wheat’. He says to him, ‘Take your writings, and write eighty’.

8.verse: And the master praised the unrighteous steward because he acted shrewdly. Because the sons of  this age are more shrewd in-relation-to their own kind than the sons of the light.

9.verse: And I say to you— make friends for yourselves by means of unrighteous wealth, so that when it fails they will welcome you into the eternal dwellings.

10.verse: The one trustworthy in a very-little thing is also trustworthy in much. And the one unrighteous in a very little thing is also unrighteous in much.

11.verse: Therefore if you did not prove-to-be trustworthy with unrighteous wealth, who will entrust the true thing to you?

12.verse: And if you did not prove-to-be trustworthy with the thing belonging to another, who will give you your own thing?

13.verse: No household-servant can be serving two masters. For either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to one and disregard the other. You cannot be serving God and wealth”.

14.verse: Jesus Rebukes The Pharisees: The Thing You Highly Value Is Worthless To God - Now the Pharisees, being money-lovers, were listening-to all these things, and they were sneering-at Him.

15.verse: And He said to them, “You are the ones declaring yourselves righteous in the sight of people, but God knows your hearts— because the highly-valued thing among people is an abomination in the sight of God.

16.verse: The Law and the Prophets were until John. From that time on, the kingdom of God is being announced-as-good-news, and everyone is forcing-himself into it.

17.verse: But it is easier that the heaven and the earth should pass away than that one stroke of the Law should fail.

18.verse: Everyone sending-away his wife and marrying another is committing-adultery. And the one marrying one having been sent-away from her husband is committing-adultery.

19.verse: The Rich Man And Lazarus: What God Values Is What Matters - “Now there was a certain rich man. And he was dressing himself in purple and fine-linen, radiantly enjoying-himself daily.

20.verse: And a certain poor man, Lazarus by name, had been put at his gate— having been covered-with-sores,

21.verse: and desiring to be filled-to-satisfaction by the things falling from the table of the rich man. Even indeed the dogs coming were licking his sores.

22.verse: And it came about that the poor man died and he was carried-away by the angels to the bosom of Abraham. And the rich man also died and was buried.

23.verse: And having lifted-up his eyes in Hades while being in torments, he sees Abraham from a-distance, and Lazarus in his bosom.

24.verse: And he, having called, said, ‘Father Abraham, have-mercy-on me and send Lazarus in order that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool-off my tongue, because I am suffering-pain in this flame’.

25.verse: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that during your life you received your good things, and likewise Lazarus the bad things. But now, here, he is being comforted and you are suffering-pain.

26.verse: And in all these regions, a great chasm has been fixed between us and you, so that the ones wanting to cross from here to you are not able, nor may they cross-over from there to us’.

27.verse: And he said, ‘Then I ask you, father, that you send him to the house of my father—

28.verse: for I have five brothers— so that he may solemnly-warn them in order that they also might not come to this place of torment’.

29.verse: But Abraham says, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them listen-to them’.

30.verse: But the one said, ‘No, father Abraham. But if someone goes to them from the dead, they will repent’.

31.verse: But he said to him, ‘If they do not listen-to Moses and the Prophets, neither will they be persuaded if someone rises-up from the dead’”.

1.verse: Woe To The One Who Causes Others To Fall. Rebuke Sin In Your Brother. Forgive - And He said to His disciples, “It is impossible that the causes-of-falling should not come. Nevertheless, woe to the one through whom they come.

2.verse: It would be better for him if a mill’s stone were lying-around his neck and he had been thrown-off into the sea, than that he should cause one of these little ones to fall.

3.verse: Take heed to yourselves— If your brother sins, rebuke him. And if he repents, forgive him.

4.verse: And if he sins against you seven times in the day, and returns to you seven times saying ‘I repent’, forgive him”.

5.verse: The Apostles Ask For More Faith. The Smallest Amount Is Enough - The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase faith for us”.

6.verse: And the Lord said, “If you have faith like a seed of a mustard-plant, you would say to this mulberry-tree, ‘Be uprooted and be planted in the sea’, and it would have obeyed you.

7.verse: And who from-among you is there who, having a slave plowing or shepherding, will say to him having come in from the field, ‘Immediately having come-to the table, fall back [to eat]!’?

8.verse: But will he not say to him, ‘Prepare something I may have-for-dinner. And having girded-yourself, be serving me until I eat and drink. And after these things, you will eat and drink’?

9.verse: He does not have gratitude for the slave because he did the things having been commanded, does he?

10.verse: So also you, when you do all the things having been commanded to you, be saying that ‘We are unprofitable slaves. We have done what we were obligated to do’”.

11.verse: Jesus Heals Ten Lepers. One Returns To Give Thanks - And it came about during the proceeding to Jerusalem that He was going through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

12.verse: And while He was entering into a certain village, ten leprous men met Him, who stood at-a-distance.

13.verse: And they lifted their voice, saying, “Jesus, Master, have-mercy-on us!”

14.verse: And having seen them, He said to them, “Having gone, show yourselves to the priests”. And it came about during their going that they were cleansed.

15.verse: And one of them, having seen that he was healed, returned glorifying God with a loud voice.

16.verse: And he fell on his face at His feet while giving-thanks to Him. And he was a Samaritan.

17.verse: And having responded, Jesus said, “Were not ten cleansed? But where are the nine?

18.verse: Were none found having returned to give glory to God except this foreigner?”

19.verse: And He said to him, “Having arisen, go. Your faith has restored you”.

20.verse: Jesus Is Asked When The Kingdom Is Coming. The Kingdom Is Within You - And having been asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God is coming, He responded to them and said, “The kingdom of God is not coming with observation,

21.verse: nor will they say, ‘Behold— here it is’, or, ‘There it is’. For behold— the kingdom of God is within you”.

22.verse: The Coming of The Son Will Be Like Lightning - And He said to the disciples, “Days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

23.verse: And they will say to you, ‘Behold— there He is’, or, ‘Behold— here He is’. Do not go, nor pursue them.

24.verse: For just like the lightning flashing out of the one part under heaven shines to the other part under heaven, so will the Son of Man be in His day.

25.verse: But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

26.verse: The Coming of The Son Will Be Like The Days of Noah And Lot - “And as it happened in the days of Noah [in Gen 6-7], so it will be also in the days of the Son of Man—

27.verse: they were eating, drinking, marrying, being given-in-marriage, until which day Noah entered into the ark and the flood came and destroyed everyone.

28.verse: Likewise, just as it happened in the days of Lot [in Gen 19]— they were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building.

29.verse: But on the day Lot departed from Sodom, it rained fire and sulphur from heaven and destroyed everyone.

30.verse: It will be the same way on the day the Son of Man is revealed.

31.verse: On that day, let he who will be on the housetop and his things in the house not go down to take them. And let the one in a field likewise not turn-back to the things behind.

32.verse: Remember Lot’s wife.

33.verse: Whoever seeks to preserve his life will lose it. But whoever loses it will keep it alive.

34.verse: I say to you, on this night there will be two people on one bed— the one will be taken, and the other will be left.

35.verse: There will be two women grinding at the same place— the one will be taken, and the other will be left.

37.verse: And having responded, they say to Him, “Where, Lord?” And the One said to them, “Where the body is, there also the vultures will be gathered-together”.

1.verse: Pray And Don’t Lose Heart: God Will Avenge His People - And He was speaking a parable to them with-regard-to it being necessary that they always be praying and not losing-heart,

2.verse: saying, “There was in a certain city a certain judge not fearing God and not having-regard-for the person.

3.verse: And there was a widow in that city. And she was coming to him, saying, ‘Avenge me from my adversary’.

4.verse: And he was not willing for a time. But after these things, he said within himself, ‘Even though I do not fear God nor have regard for the person,

5.verse: yet because of this widow’s causing me trouble, I will avenge her— in order that she, while continually coming, may not be wearing me out’”.

6.verse: And the Lord said, “Listen-to what the unrighteous judge is saying.

7.verse: And shall not God execute vengeance for His chosen ones— the ones crying-out to Him by day and by night and He is being patient with them?

8.verse: I say to you that He will execute vengeance for them quickly. However, the Son of Man having come, will He find faith on the earth?”

9.verse: Two Men In Prayer: One Exalts Himself, The Other Begs For Mercy - And He also spoke this parable to some putting-confidence upon themselves that they were righteous, and treating the rest with contempt—

10.verse: “Two men went up to the temple to pray: the one a Pharisee, and the other a tax-collector.

11.verse: The Pharisee, having stood, was praying these things to himself: ‘God, I thank You that I am not just-like the rest of the people— swindlers, unrighteous ones, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

12.verse: I fast twice a week. I give-a-tenth-of all that I get’.

13.verse: But the tax collector, standing at-a-distance, was not willing even to lift-up his eyes to heaven, but was striking his chest, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, the sinner!’

14.verse: I say to you, this one went-down to his house having been declared-righteous, rather-than that one. Because everyone exalting himself will be humbled, but the one humbling himself will be exalted”.

15.verse: Permit The Children To Come, For of Such Is The Kingdom of God - And they were also bringing babies to Him in order that He might touch them. But having seen it, the disciples were rebuking them.

16.verse: But Jesus summoned them, saying, “Permit the children to be coming to Me, and do not be forbidding them. For the kingdom of God is of such ones.

17.verse: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will never enter into it”.

18.verse: A Rich Ruler Asks What To Do To Inherit Life. Sell All You Have And Follow Me - And a certain ruler questioned Him, saying, “Good Teacher, [by] having done what shall I inherit eternal life?”

19.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good except One— God.

20.verse: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit-adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give-false-testimony, be honoring your father and mother’”.

21.verse: And the one said, “I kept these all from my youth”.

22.verse: And having heard it, Jesus said to him, “One thing is still lacking for you— Sell all that you have and distribute it to poor ones, and you will have treasure in the heavens. And come, be following Me”.

23.verse: But the one, having heard these things, became deeply-grieved. For he was extremely rich.

24.verse: And having seen him having become deeply grieved, Jesus said, “How difficultly the ones having wealth come into the kingdom of God.

25.verse: For it is easier that a camel enter through an opening of a needle than that a rich one enter into the kingdom of God”.

26.verse: All Who Leave Behind Anything For Me Will Receive Back Many Times As Much - And the ones having heard it said, “Who indeed can be saved?”

27.verse: And the One said, “The things impossible with humans are possible with God”.

28.verse: And Peter said, “Behold— we, having left our own things, followed You”.

29.verse: And the One said to them, “Truly I say to you all that there is no one who left house or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God,

30.verse: who will by any means not receive back many-times-as-much in this time, and in the coming age— eternal life”.

31.verse: Jesus Predicts His Death And Resurrection - And having taken aside the twelve, He said to them, “Behold— we are going up to Jerusalem. And all the things having been written by the prophets for the Son of Man will be fulfilled.

32.verse: For He will be handed-over to the Gentiles. And He will be mocked and mistreated and spit-on.

33.verse: And having whipped Him, they will kill Him. And on the third day, He will rise-up”.

34.verse: And they understood none of these things. Indeed this statement had been hidden from them, and they were not coming-to-know the things being said.

35.verse: A Blind Man Begs Mercy From The Messiah, And Receives His Sight - And it came about during His drawing-near to Jericho, that a certain blind one was sitting beside the road, begging.

36.verse: And having heard a crowd proceeding through, he was inquiring as to what this might be.

37.verse: And they reported to him that “Jesus the Nazarene is passing by”.

38.verse: And he shouted, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have-mercy-on me!”

39.verse: And the ones preceding Him were rebuking him in order that he might be silent. But he was crying out by much more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

40.verse: And having stood [still], Jesus ordered that he be brought to Him. And he having drawn near, He asked him,

41.verse: “What do you want Me to do for you?”

42.verse: And the one said, “Master— that I may see-again!” And Jesus said to him, “See-again! Your faith has restored you”.

43.verse: And at once he saw-again. And he was following Him, glorifying God. And all the people, having seen it, gave praise to God.

1.verse: Salvation Comes To a Rich Tax Collector Named Zacchaeus - And having entered, he was going through Jericho.

2.verse: And behold— there was a man being called by the name Zacchaeus. And he was a chief-tax-collector. And he was rich.

3.verse: And he was seeking to see Who Jesus was. And he was not able because of the crowd, because he was short in stature.

4.verse: And having run ahead to the place in front, he went up on a sycamore-tree in order that he might see Him, because He was going to come through that way.

5.verse: And when He came upon the place, having looked-up, Jesus said to him, “Zacchaeus, having hurried, come down. For today I must stay at your house”.

6.verse: And having hurried, he came down and received Him, rejoicing.

7.verse: And having seen it, they all were grumbling, saying that “He went in to take-up-lodging with a sinful man”.

8.verse: And having stood, Zacchaeus said to the Lord, “Behold, Master— I am giving half of my possessions to the poor. And if I extorted anything from anyone, I am giving it back fourfold”.

9.verse: And Jesus said with-regard-to him that “Today salvation came to this house, because even he is a son of Abraham.

10.verse: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost”.

11.verse: The Parable of The Minas: Do Business With The Resources I Have Given You - And while they were listening-to these things, having proceeded [to speak further], He spoke a parable because of His being near Jerusalem and their thinking that the kingdom of God was about to appear at-once.

12.verse: Therefore He said, “A certain well-born man traveled to a distant country to receive a kingdom for himself, and to return.

13.verse: And having called ten of his own slaves, he gave them ten minas and said to them, ‘Do business while I am coming’.

14.verse: But his citizens were hating him, and they sent-forth a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this one to be-king over us’.

15.verse: And it came about at his return, having received the kingdom, that he said that these slaves to whom he had given the money should be called to him in order that he might come-to-know what they gained-through-doing-business.

16.verse: And the first one arrived, saying, ‘Master, your mina earned ten minas’.

17.verse: And he said to him, ‘Very-well done, good slave. Because you proved-to-be faithful in a very-little thing— be having authority over ten cities’.

18.verse: And the second one came, saying, ‘Your mina, master, made five minas’.

19.verse: And he said also to this one, ‘And you— be over five cities’.

20.verse: And the other one came, saying, ‘Master, behold your mina, which I was holding, laying-away in a handkerchief.

21.verse: For I was fearing you, because you are a harsh man. You take-up what you did not lay-down, and you reap what you did not sow’.

22.verse: He says to him, ‘I will judge you out of your own mouth, evil slave. You knew that I am a harsh man, taking up what I did not lay-down and reaping what I did not sow!

23.verse: And for what reason did you not give my money to be on a [banker’s] table, and I, having come, would have collected it with interest?’

24.verse: And he said to the ones standing-near, ‘Take the mina away from him and give it to the one having the ten minas’.

25.verse: And they said to him, ‘Master, he has ten minas [already]’.

26.verse: I say to you that to everyone having, it will be given. But from the one not having, even what he has will be taken away.

27.verse: However, bring here these enemies of mine— the ones not having wanted me to be king over them— and slay them in front of me”.

28.verse: Jesus Goes Up To Jerusalem - And having said these things, He was proceeding ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

29.verse: He Enters Jerusalem Riding a Colt, To The Praise of The People. He Weeps Over The City - And it came about when He drew-near to Bethphage and Bethany— near the mountain being called ‘of Olives’— that He sent-forth two of the disciples,

30.verse: saying, “Go to the village before you, in which while proceeding you will find a colt having been tied on which none of mankind ever sat. And having untied it, bring it.

31.verse: And if someone asks you, ‘For what reason are you untying it?’, thus you shall say— that ‘The Lord has need of it’”.

32.verse: And having gone, the ones having been sent-forth found it just as He said to them.

33.verse: And while they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”

34.verse: And the ones said that “The Lord has need of it”.

35.verse: And they brought it to Jesus. And having cast their cloaks upon the colt, they put Jesus on it.

36.verse: And while He was proceeding, they were spreading their cloaks under Him in the road.

37.verse: And while He was drawing-near now, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of the disciples began to praise God, rejoicing with a loud voice for all the miracles which they saw,

38.verse: saying, “Blessed is the King coming in the name of the Lord. Peace in heaven and glory in the highest [heavens]!”

39.verse: And some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples”.

40.verse: And having responded, He said, “I say to you, if these will be silent, the stones will cry out!”

41.verse: And when He drew-near, having seen the city, He wept over it,

42.verse: saying that “If you, even you, had known on this day the things for peace! But now they were hidden from your eyes.

43.verse: Because days will come upon you— and your enemies will throw-up a palisade against you, and encircle you, and confine you from all sides.

44.verse: And they will dash you to the ground, and your children within you. And they will not leave a stone upon a stone within you, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation”.

45.verse: Jesus Throws The Merchandisers Out of The Temple. The Priests Seek To Destroy Him - And having entered into the temple, He began to throw-out the ones selling,

46.verse: saying to them, “It has been written [in Isa 56:7]: ‘And My house shall be a house of prayer’. But you made it a den of robbers”.

47.verse: And He was teaching daily in the temple. And the chief priests and the scribes and the leading ones of the people were seeking to destroy Him.

48.verse: And they were not finding what they might do, for all the people hung-on Him, listening.

1.verse: The Priests Ask By What Authority He Does This. From Where Was John’s Authority? - And it came about on one of the days while He was teaching the people in the temple and announcing-the-good-news, that the chief priests and the scribes with the elders stood-near.

2.verse: And they spoke, saying to Him, “Tell us, by what-kind-of  authority are You doing these things, or who is the one having given You this authority?”

3.verse: And having responded, He said to them, “I also will ask you a thing, and you tell Me—

4.verse: was the baptism of John from heaven, or from humans?”

5.verse: And the ones reasoned with themselves, saying that “If we say, ‘From heaven’, He will say, ‘For what reason did you not believe him?’

6.verse: But if we say, ‘From humans’, all the people will stone us to death. For they are convinced that John is a prophet”.

7.verse: And they answered that they did not know from where it was.

8.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Nor am I telling you by what-kind-of authority I am doing these things”.

9.verse: You Priests Are Like Farmers Who Killed The Owner’s Messengers And His Son - And He began to tell this parable to the people: “A certain man planted a vineyard and rented it to farmers, and went-on-a-journey for considerable periods-of-time.

10.verse: And at harvest time, he sent-forth a slave to the farmers so that they would give to him from the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers sent him out empty-handed, having beaten him.

11.verse: And he proceeded to send another slave. But the ones, having beaten and dishonored that one also, sent him out empty-handed.

12.verse: And he proceeded to send a third. But the ones also threw out this one, having wounded him.

13.verse: And the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. Perhaps they will have-regard-for this one’.

14.verse: But having seen him, the farmers were reasoning with one another, saying, ‘This one is the heir. Let us kill him in order that the inheritance may become ours’.

15.verse: And having thrown him outside of the vineyard, they killed him. Therefore, what will the owner of the vineyard do to them?

16.verse: He will come and destroy these farmers, and give the vineyard to others”. And having heard it, they said, “May it never be!”

17.verse: But As It Is Written, The Stone The Builders Rejected Became The Cornerstone - But the One, having looked-at them, said, “Then what is this having been written [in Ps 118:22]: ‘The stone which the ones building rejected, this became the head of the corner’?

18.verse: Everyone having fallen upon that stone will be broken-to-pieces. And upon whomever it may fall, it will crush him”.

19.verse: And the scribes and the chief priests sought to put their hands on Him at the very hour. And they feared the people. For they knew that He spoke this parable against them.

20.verse: The Priests Try To Snare Jesus: Shall We Pay Taxes To Caesar? - And having closely-watched Him, they sent forth spies pretending themselves to be righteous, in order that they might take-hold-of a statement of His, so as to hand Him over to the rule and the authority of the governor.

21.verse: And they questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, we know that You speak and teach correctly. And You do not receive the face, but You teach the way of God in accordance with truth.

22.verse: Is it lawful that we should give a tribute to Caesar, or not?”

23.verse: But having perceived their craftiness, He said to them,

24.verse: “Show Me a denarius. Of whom does it have an image and inscription?” And the ones said, “Of Caesar”.

25.verse: And the One said to them, “Well-then give-back the things of Caesar to Caesar, and the things of God to God”.

26.verse: And they were not able to take-hold-of a word of His in the presence of the people. And having marveled at His answer, they became silent.

27.verse: Sadducees Question Jesus About The Resurrection of a Wife With Seven Husbands - And having come to Him, some of the Sadducees— the ones denying that there is a resurrection— questioned Him,

28.verse: saying, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us [in Deut 25:5] that if a brother of someone dies having a wife, and this one is childless, that his brother should take the wife and raise-up-from her a seed for his brother.

29.verse: So there were seven brothers. And the first, having taken a wife, died childless.

30.verse: And the second.

31.verse: And the third took her. And similarly, the seven also did not leave-behind children, and died.

32.verse: Last, the woman also died.

33.verse: The woman, therefore, at the resurrection— of which of them does she become the wife? For the seven had her as wife”.

34.verse: And Jesus said to them, “The sons of  this age marry and are given-in-marriage.

35.verse: But the ones having been considered-worthy to attain that age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry, nor are they given-in-marriage.

36.verse: For they are not even still able to die, for they are angel-like. And they are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.

37.verse: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush [in Ex 3:16]— when he calls the Lord the ‘God of Abraham and God of Isaac and God of Jacob’.

38.verse: Now He is not God of dead ones, but of living ones. For to Him all are alive”.

39.verse: And having responded, some of the scribes said, “Teacher, You spoke well”.

40.verse: For they were no longer daring to ask Him anything.

41.verse: Jesus Asks How The Messiah Can Be The Son of David Since David Calls Him His Lord - And He said to them, “How is it that they say that the Christ is David’s son?

42.verse: For David himself says in the book of Psalms [110:1], ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Be sitting on My right side

43.verse: until I put Your enemies as a footstool of Your feet”’.

44.verse: Therefore David calls Him ‘Lord’. And how is He his son?”

45.verse: Jesus Warns The Disciples To Beware of The Scribes - And while all the people were listening, He said to His disciples,

46.verse: “Beware of the scribes— the ones delighting to walk around in robes, and loving greetings in the marketplaces and seats-of-honor in the synagogues and places-of-honor at the banquets;

47.verse: who are devouring the houses of the widows, and praying long for a pretense. These ones will receive greater condemnation”.

1.verse: Jesus Uses The Widow’s Offering To Illustrate True Giving - And having looked-up, He saw the rich ones throwing their gifts into the treasury.

2.verse: And He saw a certain needy widow throwing two leptos there.

3.verse: And He said, “Truly I say to you that this poor widow threw more than all.

4.verse: For all these ones threw into the gifts out of the money abounding to them. But this one, out of her lack, threw all the living which she was having.

5.verse: Jesus Says The Temple Will Be Destroyed. The Disciples Ask, When? - And while some were talking about the temple— that it has been adorned with beautiful stones and gifts-dedicated-to-God— He said,

6.verse: “As to these things which you are observing, days will come during which a stone on a stone will not be left which will not be torn-down”.

7.verse: And they questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, when therefore will these things happen? And what will be the sign when these things are about to take place?”

8.verse: Do Not Be Deceived By False Christs Or Frightened By Wars And Disturbances - And the One said, “Be watching-out that you may not be deceived. For many will come on the basis of My name, saying ‘I am the One’, and ‘The time has drawn-near’. Do not go after them.

9.verse: And whenever you hear-of wars and disturbances, do not be frightened. For these things must take place first, but it is not immediately the end”.

10.verse: There Will Be Disasters On Earth And Great Signs From Heaven - Then He was saying to them, “Nation will arise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

11.verse: There will be both great earthquakes, and famines and plagues in various places. There will be both fearful things and great signs from heaven.

12.verse: But Before All This, You Will Be Imprisoned - “But before all these things, they will put their hands on you and persecute you— they handing you over to the synagogues and prisons, you being led-away before kings and governors for-the-sake-of  My name.

13.verse: It will turn-out for you to be for a testimony.

14.verse: So put in your hearts not to prepare-beforehand to speak-a-defense.

15.verse: For I will give you a mouth, and wisdom which all the ones being opposed to you will not be able to resist or to speak-against.

16.verse: And you will be handed-over even by parents and brothers and relatives and friends. And they will put some of you to death.

17.verse: And you will be being hated by all because of My name.

18.verse: And a hair of your head will by no means be lost.

19.verse: Gain your souls by your endurance.

20.verse: And You Will See Days of Vengeance And Wrath Against This People - “But when you see Jerusalem being surrounded by army-encampments, then recognize that her desolation has drawn-near.

21.verse: Then let the ones in Judea be fleeing to the mountains. And let the ones in the midst of her be going-out. And let the ones in the fields not be entering into her.

22.verse: Because these are days of vengeance, that all the things having been written may be fulfilled.

23.verse: Woe to the ones having a child in the womb, and to the ones nursing in those days. For there will be a great distress upon the land, and wrath against this people.

24.verse: And they will fall by the edge of the sword. And they will be taken-captive to all the nations. And Jerusalem will be being trampled by the Gentiles until which time the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

25.verse: Then They Will See The Son Coming On The Clouds With Great Glory - “And there will be signs in the sun and moon and stars, and on earth the anguish of nations in perplexity about the roar of the sea and wave-tossing—

26.verse: people fainting from fear and the expectation of the things coming-upon the world. For the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

27.verse: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

28.verse: Now [when] these things [are] beginning to take place, straighten-up and lift-up your heads, because your redemption is drawing-near”.

29.verse: The Parable of The Fig Tree: When You See This You Know The Kingdom Is Near - And He spoke a parable to them: “Look at the fig-tree, and all the trees.

30.verse: When they already put-forth leaves, seeing it, you know from yourselves that summer is already near.

31.verse: So also you— when you see these things taking place, you know that the kingdom of God is near.

32.verse: Truly I say to you that this generation will by no means pass away until all things take place.

33.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will by-no-means pass away.

34.verse: Be Prepared And Keep Alert - “But take heed to yourselves that your hearts may not at any time be weighed-down with carousing and drunkenness and anxieties pertaining-to-life, and that unexpected day suddenly-come-upon you

35.verse: like a snare. For it will come-in-upon all the ones sitting on the face of all the earth.

36.verse: And be keeping-alert in every season, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things being about to take place, and to stand before the Son of Man”.

37.verse: Jesus Spends His Days In The Temple and His Nights On The Mount of Olives - Now as to the days, He was teaching in the temple. But as to the nights, going out [of Jerusalem], He was spending-the-night on the mountain being called ‘of Olives’.

38.verse: And all the people were arising-very-early to come to Him in the temple to hear Him.

1.verse: The Priests Plot How To Kill Jesus - Now the Feast of Unleavened-Bread, the one being called Passover, was drawing-near.

2.verse: And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking as to how they might kill Him, for they were fearing the people.

3.verse: Judas Betrays Jesus To The Priests - And Satan entered into Judas, the one being called “Iscariot”, being one of the number of the twelve.

4.verse: And having gone, he talked-with the chief priests and [temple] captains as to how he might hand Him over to them.

5.verse: And they rejoiced and agreed to give him money.

6.verse: And he consented, and was seeking a favorable-opportunity that he might hand Him over without a crowd with them.

7.verse: Jesus Celebrates Passover With The Twelve - And the [first] day of the Feast of Unleavened-Bread came— on which it-was-necessary that the Passover [lamb] be sacrificed.

8.verse: And He sent-forth Peter and John, having said, “Having gone, prepare the Passover [meal] for us in order that we may eat it ”.

9.verse: And the ones said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare it?”

10.verse: And the One said to them, “Behold— you having entered into the city, a man will meet you carrying a jar of water. Follow him to the house into which he proceeds.

11.verse: And you will say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest-room where I may eat the Passover [meal] with My disciples?”’

12.verse: And that one will show you a large upstairs-room having been spread [with furnishings]. Prepare it there”.

13.verse: And having gone, they found it just as He had told them. And they prepared the Passover [meal].

14.verse: The Bread And The Wine Are Given a New Meaning - And when the hour came, He fell back [to eat], and the apostles with Him.

15.verse: And He said to them, “I greatly desired to eat this Passover [meal] with you before I suffer.

16.verse: For I say to you that I will by no means eat it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God”.

17.verse: And having taken a cup, having given-thanks, He said “Take this and distribute it to yourselves.

18.verse: For I say to you that I will by no means drink from the fruit of the grapevine from now on until which time the kingdom of God comes”.

19.verse: And having taken bread, having given-thanks, He broke it and gave it to them, saying “This is My body, the one being given for you. Be doing this for My remembrance”.

20.verse: And similarly the cup after the dining, saying “This cup is the new covenant in My blood— the blood being poured-out for you.

21.verse: Yet behold— the hand of the one handing Me over is with Mine on the table!

22.verse: Because the Son of Man is proceeding according-to the thing having been determined— nevertheless, woe to that man by whom He is being handed-over!”

23.verse: And they began to discuss with themselves as to which of them then the one going to do this thing might be.

24.verse: The Disciples Argue Over Who Is Greatest. The Greatest Is The Servant of All - And a contention also took place among them as to which of them seems to be greater.

25.verse: And the One said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles are lording-over them. And the ones having-authority over them are calling-themselves ‘Benefactors’.

26.verse: But you shall not be so. But let the greater one among you be like the younger one; and the one leading like the one serving.

27.verse: For who is greater, the one reclining-back [to eat] or the one serving? Is it not the one reclining-back? But I am in your midst as the One serving!

28.verse: But you are the ones having continued with Me in My trials.

29.verse: And I am conferring you a kingdom, just as My Father conferred Me

30.verse: so that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom. And you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.verse: Peter Will Deny Jesus - “Simon, Simon. Behold— Satan asked-for you all that he might sift you like wheat.

32.verse: But I prayed for you, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned-back, establish your brothers”.

33.verse: But the one said to Him, “Lord, I am prepared to go with You even to prison and to death!”

34.verse: And the One said, “I say to you, Peter, a rooster will not crow today until you deny three-times that you know Me”.

35.verse: Jesus Tells The Disciples To Prepare For a New Assignment - And He said to them, “When I sent you out without money-bag and [traveler’s] bag and sandals, you did not lack anything, did you?” And the ones said, “Nothing”.

36.verse: And He said to them, “But now let the one having a money-bag take it. Likewise also a [traveler’s] bag. And let the one not having one sell his cloak and buy a sword.

37.verse: For I say to you that this [saying] having been written [in Isa 53:12] must be fulfilled in Me: ‘And He was counted with lawless ones’. For indeed the thing concerning Me has a fulfillment”.

38.verse: And the ones said, “Lord, behold— here are two swords”. And the One said to them, “It is enough”.

39.verse: Jesus Waits And Prays On The Mount of Olives - And having gone out, He went in accordance with His custom to the Mount of Olives. And the disciples also, they followed Him.

40.verse: And having come-to-be at the place, He said to them, “Be praying that you may not enter into temptation”.

41.verse: And He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw. And having put down His knees, He was praying,

42.verse: saying “Father, if You are willing, remove this cup from Me. Yet let not My will, but Yours be done”.

43.verse: And an angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him.

44.verse: And having come-to-be in agony, He was praying more-fervently. And His sweat became like drops of blood going down upon the ground.

45.verse: And having arisen from prayer, having come to the disciples, He found them being asleep because of grief.

46.verse: And He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Having stood-up, be praying that you may not enter into temptation”.

47.verse: Jesus Is Betrayed With a Kiss, And Arrested - While He was still speaking, behold— a crowd. And the one being called Judas, one of the twelve, was preceding them. And he drew-near to Jesus to kiss Him.

48.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you handing-over the Son of Man with a kiss?”

49.verse: And the ones around Him, having seen the thing which will happen, said “Lord, shall we strike with a sword?”

50.verse: And a certain one of them struck the slave of the high priest and took-off his right ear.

51.verse: But having responded, Jesus said, “Allow up to this”. And having touched his ear, He healed him.

52.verse: And Jesus said to the chief priests and captains of the temple and elders having come against Him, “Did you come out with swords and clubs as-if against a robber?

53.verse: Daily while I was being with you in the temple, you did not stretch-out your hands against Me. But this is your hour, and the authority of darkness”.

54.verse: Jesus Is Led Into The House of The High Priest; Peter Denies Him Three Times - And having arrested Him, they led Him, and brought Him into the house of the high priest. And Peter was following at-a-distance.

55.verse: And they having kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and having sat-down-together, Peter was sitting amidst them.

56.verse: And a certain servant-girl, having seen him sitting toward the light, and having looked-intently at him, said “This one also was with Him”.

57.verse: But the one denied it, saying “I do not know Him, woman”.

58.verse: And after a short time, another man having seen him said, “You also are one of them”. But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”

59.verse: And about one hour having passed, a certain other man was insisting, saying “In accordance with truth, this one also was with Him, for he also is a Galilean”.

60.verse: But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying”. And at-once, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

61.verse: And having turned, the Lord looked-at Peter. And Peter was reminded of the word of the Lord— how He said to him that “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny Me three-times”.

62.verse: And having gone outside, he wept bitterly.

63.verse: And the men holding Him were mocking Him while beating Him.

64.verse: And having covered Him, they were asking Him, saying “Prophesy— who is the one having hit You?”

65.verse: And blaspheming, they were saying many other things against Him.

66.verse: Jesus Is Led Before The Sanhedrin. He Tells Them He Is The Son of God - And when it became day, the Council-of-elders of the people was gathered together— both chief priests and scribes. And they led Him away to their council [chamber],

67.verse: saying “If You are the Christ, tell us”. But He said to them, “If I tell you, you will by no means believe.

68.verse: And if I question you, you will by no means answer.

69.verse: But from now on, the Son of Man will be sitting on the right side of the power of God”.

70.verse: And they all said, “Are You then the Son of God?” And the One said to them, “You are saying that I am”.

71.verse: And the ones said, “What further need do we have of testimony? For we ourselves heard it from His mouth”.

1.verse: Jesus Is Led Before Pilate. He Tells Him He Is The King of The Jews - And having arisen, the whole assembly of them led Him before Pilate.

2.verse: And they began to accuse Him, saying “We found this One perverting our nation, and forbidding to give tributes to Caesar, and saying that He is Christ, a King”.

3.verse: And Pilate asked Him, saying “Are You the King of the Jews?” And the One, having responded to him, said “You are saying it ”.

4.verse: And Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no guilt in this man”.

5.verse: But the ones were insisting, saying that “He is stirring-up the people, teaching throughout all Judea— having indeed begun from Galilee, as far as here”.

6.verse: And Pilate, having heard it, asked if the man was a Galilean.

7.verse: And having learned that He was from the authority of Herod, he sent Him up to Herod— he also being in Jerusalem during these days.

8.verse: Before Herod, Jesus Says Nothing - Now Herod, having seen Jesus, rejoiced greatly. For he was wanting to see Him for considerable periods-of-time because of hearing about Him. And he was hoping to see some sign being done by Him.

9.verse: And he was questioning Him with many words, but He answered him nothing.

10.verse: And the chief priests and the scribes were standing there, accusing Him vigorously.

11.verse: And Herod also— with his troops— having treated Him with contempt, and having mocked Him, having clothed Him with shining clothing, sent Him back to Pilate.

12.verse: Now both Herod and Pilate became friends with one another on the very day. For they were-previously existing with hostility toward them.

13.verse: Pilate Offers To Release Jesus. The Crowd Demands He Be Crucified - Now Pilate, having called-together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

14.verse: said to them, “You brought me this man as One turning-away the people. And behold— I, having examined Him in your presence, found no guilt in this man of the things which you are accusing against Him.

15.verse: But neither did Herod, for he sent Him back to us. And behold— nothing worthy of death has been committed by Him.

16.verse: Therefore, having disciplined Him, I will release Him”.

18.verse: But they cried-out all-together, saying, “Take away this One, and release Barabbas for us”—

19.verse: who had been thrown in prison because of a certain rebellion having taken place in the city, and murder.

20.verse: And again Pilate addressed them, wanting to release Jesus.

21.verse: But the ones were calling-out, saying “Crucify, crucify Him!”

22.verse: And a third time the one said to them, “What indeed did this One do wrong? I found no guilt worthy of death in Him. Therefore, having disciplined Him, I will release Him”.

23.verse: But the ones were pressing-upon him with loud voices, asking that He be crucified. And their voices were prevailing.

24.verse: And Pilate decided that their request should be done.

25.verse: And he released the one having been thrown into prison because of rebellion and murder, whom they were asking-for. And he handed-over Jesus to their will.

26.verse: Jesus Is Crucified - And when they led Him away, having taken-hold-of a certain Simon, a Cyrenian coming from the country, they laid the cross on him to carry behind Jesus.

27.verse: And a large crowd of the people, and of women who were beating-their-breasts and lamenting Him, was following Him.

28.verse: But having turned to them, Jesus said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not be weeping for Me. But weep for yourselves and for your children.

29.verse: Because behold— days are coming during which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, and the wombs which did not bear and breasts which did not feed’.

30.verse: At-that-time they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us’, and to the hills, ‘Cover us’.

31.verse: Because if they are doing these things in-the-case-of the wet wood, what will happen in-the-case-of the dry?”

32.verse: And two other criminals were also being led to be executed with Him.

33.verse: And when they came to the place being called “The Skull”, there they crucified Him and the criminals— one on the right side, and the other on the left side.

34.verse: But Jesus was saying, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing”. And they cast lots, dividing His garments among themselves.

35.verse: The King of The Jews Is Mocked While Hanging On The Cross - And the people were standing there watching. And the rulers were also sneering-at Him, saying “He saved others. Let Him save Himself if this One is the Christ of God, the Chosen One”.

36.verse: And the soldiers also mocked Him, coming to Him, offering Him sour-wine,

37.verse: and saying “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself ”.

38.verse: And there was also an inscription over Him— “This is the King of the Jews”.

39.verse: And one of the criminals having been hung was blaspheming Him, saying “Are You not the Christ? Save Yourself and us”.

40.verse: But having responded, the other, rebuking him, said “Do you not even fear God? Because you are under the same condemnation!

41.verse: And we are suffering justly, for we are receiving-back things worthy of the things which we did— but this One did nothing out-of-place”.

42.verse: And he was saying, “Jesus, remember me when You come into Your kingdom”.

43.verse: And He said to him, “Truly I say to you, you will be with Me today in paradise”.

44.verse: Darkness Comes Over the Land And The Temple Curtain Is Torn. Jesus Dies - And it was now about the sixth hour. And a darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour,

45.verse: the sun having failed. And the curtain of the temple was torn in-the-middle.

46.verse: And having called-out with a loud voice, Jesus said, “Father, I commend My spirit into Your hands”. And having said this, He expired.

47.verse: And having seen the thing having taken place, the centurion was glorifying God, saying “This man really was righteous”.

48.verse: And all the crowds having come together for this sight, having watched the things having taken place, were returning striking their chests.

49.verse: But all His acquaintances and the women accompanying Him from Galilee were standing at a distance while seeing these things.

50.verse: Jesus Is Buried In a Tomb On Friday Afternoon Before Sunset - And behold, there was a man, Joseph by name— being a council-member and a good and righteous man

51.verse: ( this one had not consented to the plan and their action)— from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who was waiting-for the kingdom of God.

52.verse: This one, having gone to Pilate, asked-for the body of Jesus.

53.verse: And having taken it down, he wrapped it in linen-cloth, and laid Him in a tomb cut-in-the-rock where no one was yet lying.

54.verse: And it was the day of Preparation, and the Sabbath was dawning.

55.verse: On Sunday Morning, The Women Go To The Tomb And Discover That Jesus Is Risen - Now having closely-followed, the women who had come-with Him from Galilee saw the tomb and how His body was laid.

56.verse: And having returned, they prepared spices and perfumes. And on the Sabbath they rested in-accordance-with the commandment—

1.verse: but on the first day of the week at deep dawn, they went to the tomb bringing the spices which they prepared.

2.verse: And they found the stone having been rolled-away from the tomb.

3.verse: But having gone in, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.verse: And it came about during their being perplexed about this, that behold— two men stood-near them in gleaming clothing.

5.verse: And they having become terrified and bowing their faces to the ground, they said to them, “Why are you seeking the Living One among the dead?

6.verse: He is not here, but He arose. Remember how He spoke to you while still being in Galilee,
